review:
Simply put, Overwatch 2 is a perversion of it's predecessor.

I still love the idea of this game, and honestly, if I played a match right now, I might have fun. Despite this, I can't agree witht eh choices the developers have made since it became Overwatch 2. It's no secret that the "2" isn't earned and, with PvE being gone, is basically nothing more than marketing now.

Out of everything, what I can't stand is how this game treats new players. People who download Overwatch 2 for the first time only start with [i]less than half[/i] of the roster, 13 heroes out of (currently) 35. The heroes from the previous game don't take long to get, but new heroes? That's where the grind comes in. If you just like casual play like I do, you probably aren't the kind of person who likes to grind, but if you want all of the heroes, you have no choice. Even then, say a hero comes out in the current gameplay season. In that case, you either buy the Battle Pass or wait until next season and grind.

It just hurts to see something I once really enjoyed become something so crippled. I simply don't agree with locking key elements to the game behind paywalls. Sure, the original Overwatch had loot boxes, and as much as those can suck, everything you got from them changed nothing in the gameplay and only provided some cosmetic options. Now, in a game about team play and composition, a player might not be able to choose the best hero for a situation because they don't want to/can't pay or grind for them.

I remember when Overwatch was about togetherness and teamwork. I never thought we'd have to pay to keep those things.
believe me u will be mentally tired
Es como hacerse una paja pero nada que ver
aleluia veio para steam jogo ta bom, foda q sou acustomado a jogar no ps4, meu sonho Ã© q lance crossplay para rank tbmmm, enfim jogo bom
At the very least we don't need the blizzard launcher to play the game now, not that makes the game any better.

I don't know what I expected when I installed this again. It has become a degenerate wasteland, quickly filling into cesspool of molded suits and ties working as camouflage to keep the grimy hundred dollar bills and tissues filled with gamer tears out of your sight. 
     Don't be fooled by the small bits and pieces of nostalgia floating to the top, because there is hook hidden within those layers of joyful memories, laughs, and the echos from the stadium that once held the overwatch league. It leads a dangerous path the soulless hands which left filth on those hidden green slices of paper. 
     These hands simply do not care, and will refuse to have a single thought about anything but the greed that feeds the bottomless hole where their soul once lived. 
     They want you to believe that simply is not enough life left in the three hundred they have below them creating the content that you and I consume. That it is just too difficult for the man making two hundred thousand dollars to sit and create for more then two hours of the day, or even the other six that come with it. 
    But then the man that works so little and is rewarded so much, blames the hands that control him. with a result that consist of a very dedicated and once passionate gamers are now sitting exhausted with bags under their eyes questioning why they allow the white void with only the disheartening words "overwatch 2" to blind them and create a brain once equal to the appearance of a ten week old Shar Pei, to have the texture of a quarts block. Smooth.

    This fragmented memory of a giant, no - this memory of a titan we called Blizzard is no more. The result of money and greed has only lead to the same outcome of these other giants of the industry. 
    Overwatch 2 has zero excuses to be this lacking in the one thing that it needs, fucking content. A simple google search will tell you that there are at least 300 devs on the overwatch team currently. Now what that consist of I don't know. But I do know that with a multi million dollar buy in for OWL (which will not exist because they some how manage to create only things that implode), season pass, an in game store that is IMMEDIATELY shoved down your gullet the moment you hit log in, is set to the same predatory, schemey, slimey shit that epic also does. 
     You want this sick skin we made? that will 2300 Overwatch doubloons (or what the fuck they are called). so you pay the crisp $25 for 2500 stinky butthole coins and you buy that skin you now are left with an amount that will not be able to buy anything. not enough coins so that you only have to pay $5, instead you have to move back up to the $10 or $15 range. 
    oh but what about this package you get if you spend $20. You get this shitty little charm for your gun. yay!
    or what about having something in the store for a single coin right before the season ends. you have 500 coins so that seems like no big deal... until the next season of leftovers arrives and you want to get the battlepass. 
            well shit, you cant spend $5 because if you do thats only 500 coins. and thats not going to work with a battlepass that is 1000 coins. because now you are at 999, so you HAVE to pay the full $10. I understand that its just 10 dollars for ONLY COSMETIC content and the occasional hero that the ranked community wont be able to use for 2 weeks anyways.
     but now you are at 1499 coins when the bulk deal is at 1500 coins. 

        do you see what I mean by this, its predator behavior after something that is losing its value with the current state of the world anyway. so that 10, 15, 20 dollars feels like much more.

      Micro transactions being thrown into my ass with zero lube the moment I boot up the ole PC has to be the most disrespectful thing they could think of with zero maps, zero new game modes, and another shit tier even that is done on the same map since 2016 it puts its place up there with Charlie's steam dumpster dives for overpriced asset flips. 

This "new" event that was advertised as all the other events, this one is special, its STORY MISSIONS, so you have to pay.
the free event is just clips from the fucking anime with a new voice over and pve content we have all seen since the first pve event

It's absolutely wild that people making that of a fraction what these people make have come up with solutions and basically told us to fuck off. 

they prioritize the 'political' direction they think will make them money over any overall content on the game. 
which I don't have an issue with it until the game is plummeting, everyone hates it, and then they PRETEND like they care to only steal that fucking dollar bill in your back pocket

long story short, I have over 4k hours and several times hit top 500 on this shit storm. I'm going to keep playing because I have so many hours and I'm comfortable playing it. 
its sad to see how awesome it was to now drown in microtransactions and dry content

There are a lot of negative review comparing the game to overwatch 1, and many of them are bringing up very valid points.
However, if you're not concerned with cosmetics I think that the game itself is actually very fun. The gameplay has improved over overwatch 1 imo, as with one less tank you feel more effective in game rather than mindlessly shooting at shields. There is also much more frequent content than in overwatch 1, such as maps and hero's outside of the overpriced cosmetics that keep the game fresh (to be completely fair overwatch 1 was getting stale, and desperately needed the content that overwatch 2 has brought).
My honest review is that if the idea of a competitive team based shooter appeals to you, you're probably going to have fun with the game, as the core gameplay is quite good. Just be warned if you want any cosmetics you're gonna get ripped off.

Overwatch 2 is nothing short of a game-changer in the world of first-person shooters. As a dedicated fan of the original Overwatch, I had high expectations for the sequel, and I can confidently say that Blizzard has not disappointed.

The first thing that struck me was the stunning visual upgrade. The character models, maps, and overall environment have been meticulously crafted with attention to detail. The vibrant colors and improved textures breathe new life into the game, making battles feel more immersive and dynamic than ever before.

The addition of new heroes is a breath of fresh air. Each new character feels unique and well-balanced, seamlessly integrating into the existing roster. The hero abilities are creative and add depth to the gameplay, requiring strategic thinking and teamwork to secure victory. The diversity in playstyles ensures that there's a hero for everyone, whether you prefer close combat, long-range engagements, or support roles.

One of the standout features is the highly anticipated story mode. Blizzard has taken the rich lore of Overwatch and turned it into a captivating narrative experience. The story missions delve deep into the backgrounds of our beloved characters, adding layers to their personalities and motivations. The co-op aspect of the story mode encourages teamwork, fostering a sense of camaraderie among players.

The multiplayer mode retains the fast-paced, adrenaline-pumping action that made the original game a hit. The introduction of Push, a new game mode, brings a fresh competitive edge that requires constant strategy adjustments and teamwork. The familiar modes are still here, but the tweaks and refinements make the gameplay even more balanced and enjoyable.

Blizzard's commitment to fostering a positive gaming community is evident in the enhanced social features of Overwatch 2. The Group Finder and improved communication tools make it easier than ever to find like-minded players and coordinate strategies. The emphasis on team play promotes a more supportive and cooperative environment.

While Overwatch 2 builds upon the foundation of the first game, it also represents a significant evolution. The game's design and mechanics have clearly been refined based on player feedback, resulting in a more polished and enjoyable experience. The crossplay functionality further widens the player base, reducing wait times and ensuring a thriving community.
held my money hostage for 5 hours blizzard get your shit together ^_^

I have played this game for so many hours and still regularly enjoy the gameplay. I cannot however recommend a game that is so unfathomably money hungry to the point of locking PvE (a feature promised years ago and was cancelled) behind a 15$ paywall, as well as recycled 7 year old content behind even larger price tags. 

It makes me so incredibly sad to leave this review, because behind the unfeeling corporate machine that is Blizzard, is a development team that very clearly cares about Overwatch and its universe. All of the shorts they have put out recently is a prime example of this, each one overflowing with soul and love for this game and its characters. (Huffs copium) Hopefully with Microsoft's acquisition of Blizzard, some of this can change and Overwatch can return to even just a fragment of its original glory.

Back in 2017 I made the mistake of purchasing Overwatch to appease a friend, got a few mediocre few hours in and got too busy with life and didn't play it for several months. When I finally got enough free time and boredom to try it again I can't login, or at-least stay logged in. After logging in less than 10 seconds later I am kicked out to the login screen every single time reliably for several months. Footage --> https://youtu.be/okgFgMXUQjc . After trying every single trick in the forums even reinstalling windows and all drivers, I contacted  support who gave me the run around I.E. go back to the forms. So I requested a refund seeing that he game is completely unplayable since there is no offline modes at all and  logging in is impossible. Blizzard told me to fuck off and I lost 40$. 
What does this have to do with overwatch 2? A grudge mostly, just wanted to add to the dogpile but the lack of offline modes is pathetic, no single player as promised blah blah blah. But most importantly after 34gbs downloaded and 12 minutes I spent messing around in training mode I noticed that you will be kicked for being AFK while messing with settings IN A TRAINING MODE AGAINST BOTS. FUUUCKING WOW. Can't run bots offline, wow, amazing. 2017 was a long time ago and nothing has changed, other than I can login now. Still missing that 40$ and wasted time though. GO FUCK YOURSELF BLIZZARD. 
Overwatch has always been shit rippoff of TF2 btw. still is and always will be.
